Living outside of control

September 27, 2024

You can lean away from life. Not push it too hard. This doesnâ€™t make any difference and thatâ€™s the point.

Sometimes though, you want to hit life hard. Get right in it. Shove it along, in one direction or another.

You wonâ€™t know if youâ€™ve ruined your life forever. Or if youâ€™ve put everything in place for all your dreams to come true. What is a ruined life? And what are these dreams coming true? For how long? A week? A year? Then what?

You can lean away from life. Not push it too hard. Let things settle back down before you hit it again.

You think like this when you think youâ€™re in control. Youâ€™re not. Life hits you, idiot.

Billions of people make decisions that have nothing to do with you. A moment of attention. A moment of inattention. Then their decisions change your life. Change you. Youâ€™re thinking small. Youâ€™re thinking about direct decisions people make about whether to hire you or love you. No thatâ€™s not it. Think bigger.

Think about the phone with the dead battery leading to the half acknowledged decision to ask a stranger for the time. Knowing the time leads to hurry, and hurry leads to inattention. Inattention leads to missing an opportunity. Missing an opportunity leaves life open to a different opportunity. Or does that inattention lead to an accident, creating an opportunity, a new direction and a new way of thinking.

Do you understand yet? You donâ€™t because you canâ€™t let go. You choose what to eat for breakfast so all of life is controlled with choice. Really?

Control is not a game you play with life. You donâ€™t have it. Think outside yourself. Think bigger than what you can perceive within the walls of the room you occupy. Think of the system of people following lives similar to your own. Think of the systems supporting their lives, providing food, houses and jobs. You go about your life. They do the same.

These systems are replicated throughout your country. People going to work. People getting food. People seeking entertainment. Copy paste, copy paste, copy paste. Then we have a world. Different flavours of the same systems.

Can you see it now? You canâ€™t control these systems. You canâ€™t stop people needing food and shelter. You canâ€™t stop people needing to add value to the system to get food and shelter.

Youâ€™re going to think you have a choice about the part you play in the system and whether you can game the system to your advantage. For what? More food? More shelter?

Do you understand now? There are no ruined lives. There are no dreams coming true. Lies youâ€™re told so you stay in the system. Produce more. Get more. Spend more.

Your control is limited to how you handle life as itâ€™s happening to you. Do you ride it and get deep into the experience? Or do you hop off and let it flow by? You donâ€™t know what asking the stranger for the time is going to change so let go of that control.

Youâ€™re dead soon anyway. Youâ€™ll lie there judging your life and how you lived it. Youâ€™re going to get hurt by decisions made by other people. Youâ€™re also going to feel joy. You arenâ€™t going to look back and feel satisfaction about all the pain you saved yourself from. Maybe you are. You can worry about your phone dying and see what difference it makes. How will you know your worry is worth it?

Iâ€™m going to remember all the people that thanked me for touching their lives. Thank you for letting me be a part of all your lives. A life of thousands of conversations where I was focused outside myself. The selfish pleasure of helping people.
